name: labyrinthitis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a disease that affects the labyrinth (= part of the inner ear) and causes someone to feel sick and as if they are going to fall: The typical symptoms of labyrinthitis are dizziness, vertigo, nausea and loss of balance.
More examplesFewer examplesPatients that have in the past experienced labyrinthitis (infection or inflammation of the inner ear) know how disabling this problem can be.My doctor told me that there is no medicine to cure labyrinthitis.The symptoms of labyrinthitis usually only last for a relatively short period of time - days or weeks.Sudden dizziness, particularly with room spinning, is often caused by labyrinthitis - inflammation of the inner ear or labyrinth, which controls our balance and posture.
